docs.snippet: “Free” social networking sites cost more than we think....
docs.lead_paragraph: “Free” social networking sites cost more than we think.

headline.main: Mark Zuckerberg, Let Me Pay for Facebook
headline.print_headline: What ‘Free’ Really Costs

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Zeynep Tufekci observes that ad-financed Internet services like Facebook and Google, widely perceived as free, are in fact paid for with user data; says system, with only modicum of profit per user, incentivizes massive platforms with huge data-collection networks; proposes new system of micropayments that would allow users to retain their privacy at a cost.

docs.snippet: Take all the photos you want, back them up automatically into the cloud and use Google’s image search abilities to find them later....
docs.lead_paragraph: Take all the photos you want, back them up automatically into the cloud and use Google’s image search abilities to find them later.

headline.main: Upload the Pictures, and Let Google Photos Do the Rest
headline.print_headline: Upload the Pictures, and Let Google Photos Do the Rest

docs.abstract: Gadgetwise column; free Google Photos service allows user's images to be stored in cloud for later retrieval by Google's powerful image search system.

docs.snippet: Are you concerned about the amount of information Internet companies are collecting about you?...

headline.main: Would You Be Willing to Pay for Facebook or Google in Exchange for Your Privacy?

docs.abstract: Are you concerned about the amount of information Internet companies are collecting about you?

docs.snippet: Google’s driverless cars are ready to take the road, and the use of that technology is a good thing for us all....
docs.lead_paragraph: Google’s driverless cars are ready to take the road, and the use of that technology is a good thing for us all.

headline.main: Look, Ma, No Hands!
headline.print_headline: Look, Ma, No Hands!

docs.abstract: Joe Nocera Op-Ed column disputes fears that completely autonomous automobiles being created by Google are more dangerous and accident prone than cars that allow human driver to take over; points to data showing that most accidents involving self-driving cars involve human element; contends autonomous automobiles may present privacy issue, but not safety one.

docs.snippet: A marketing manager at Google and a director at Fluxx Labs were married Saturday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A marketing manager at Google and a director at Fluxx Labs were married Saturday.

headline.main: Andrea Cohan, Tanya Liszniansky
headline.print_headline: Andrea Cohan,  Tanya Liszniansky

docs.snippet: The bride is a vice president of Morgan Stanley, and the groom works for Google....
docs.lead_paragraph: The bride is a vice president of Morgan Stanley, and the groom works for Google.

headline.main: Stephanie Witkin and Matthew Shapiro
headline.print_headline: Stephanie Witkin, Matthew Shapiro

docs.snippet: In Republican states, there is much less therapy than there is in Democratic ones, and people are suffering....
docs.lead_paragraph: In Republican states, there is much less therapy than there is in Democratic ones, and people are suffering.

headline.main: Talking Red State Blues
headline.print_headline: Talking Red State Blues

docs.abstract: Seth Stephens-Davidowitz Op-Ed article details how Google search data shows that little-known difference between Republican-leaning states and Democratic-leaning states is that the latter are far more likely to use therapy to treat mental illness; suggests that there may be more of a stigma surrounding mental illness in red states.

docs.snippet: Google and other tech dreamers think machines can make languages superfluous....
docs.lead_paragraph: Google and other tech dreamers think machines can make languages superfluous.

headline.main: Is Translation an Art or a Math Problem?
headline.print_headline: Tower of Babble

docs.abstract: Google and other innovators are working to realize dream of machine translation, or computers that can accurately and smoothly translate language; computer scientists emphasize accuracy over style and draw distinction between human and computer contributions to field, but some question where borders lie.

docs.snippet: A growing number of European cloud computing companies are trying to take on American competitors like Google and Microsoft by playing up their privacy credentials...

headline.main: European Cloud Companies Play Up Privacy Credentials
headline.print_headline: European Tech Companies Play Up Privacy to Challenge Bigger American Rivals

docs.abstract: A growing number of European cloud computing companies are trying to take on American competitors like Google and Microsoft by playing up their privacy credentials

docs.lead_paragraph: On this interactive Google map, explore street view and find things to do in Zagreb.

headline.main: 36 Hours in Zagreb

docs.snippet: Google’s new venture, Sidewalk Labs, will pursue technologies to cut pollution, curb energy use, streamline transportation and reduce the cost of urban living....

headline.main: Daily Report: Google Sets Its Sights on Improving City Life

docs.abstract: Google’s new venture, Sidewalk Labs, will pursue technologies to cut pollution, curb energy use, streamline transportation and reduce the cost of urban living.

docs.snippet: Google’s Sidewalk Labs will pursue technologies to cut pollution, curb energy use, streamline transportation and reduce the cost of city living....
docs.lead_paragraph: Google’s Sidewalk Labs will pursue technologies to cut pollution, curb energy use, streamline transportation and reduce the cost of city living.

headline.main: Sidewalk Labs, a Start-Up Created by Google, Has Bold Aims to Improve City Living
headline.print_headline: Google Sets Its Sights on Urban Life

docs.abstract: Google is launching independent company called Sidewalk Labs, which will devise new technologies to improve urban life; Daniel L Doctoroff will head firm, which will explore ways to cut pollution, reduce energy use and streamline transportation.

docs.snippet: Amazon beat Google to the acquisition of a popular gaming video service. Now Google is responding with a new YouTube Gaming application....

headline.main: YouTube Takes On Amazon With New Gaming App
headline.print_headline: Google To Release Gaming Portal This Summer

docs.abstract: Amazon beat Google to the acquisition of a popular gaming video service. Now Google is responding with a new YouTube Gaming application.

docs.snippet: The authorities want the ruling to apply to all of Google’s domains like Google.com, though the company contends that Europe’s privacy legislation should apply only to its regional domains....

headline.main: France Wants Google to Apply ‘Right to Be Forgotten’ Ruling Worldwide or Face Penalties

docs.abstract: The authorities want the ruling to apply to all of Google’s domains like Google.com, though the company contends that Europe’s privacy legislation should apply only to its regional domains.

docs.snippet: Matt Murphy, who had close connections to Google and other prominent tech investments, is joining Menlo Ventures as a managing director....
docs.lead_paragraph: Matt Murphy, who had close connections to Google and other prominent tech investments, is joining Menlo Ventures as a managing director.

headline.main: Top Executive at Kleiner Perkins to Make Rare Silicon Valley Shift, to Menlo Ventures
headline.print_headline: Venture Shift

docs.abstract: DealBook Online; Menlo Ventures announces that Matt Murphy will leave Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers to become its new managing director; shift marks rare leap from one of Silicon Valley's top venture capital firms to another.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

docs.snippet: Google is becoming more public about its data centers, talking about its network and how much fiber it owns. The idea is to show off assets that Amazon, Microsoft and IBM cannot match in the competition for cloud customers....

headline.main: Google Is Its Own Secret Weapon in the Cloud

docs.abstract: Google is becoming more public about its data centers, talking about its network and how much fiber it owns. The idea is to show off assets that Amazon, Microsoft and IBM cannot match in the competition for cloud customers.

docs.snippet: Five performing groups have united to create a new avenue for streaming their live recordings via Google Play Music....
docs.lead_paragraph: Five performing groups have united to create a new avenue for streaming their live recordings via Google Play Music.

headline.main: Classical Live Offers Orchestras Another Internet Stage
headline.print_headline: Live From New York and Beyond, to Your Earbuds

docs.abstract: Classical Live, initiative created by five major orchestras to globally broaden their audiences, announces partnership with Google Play Music to sell initiative's live recordings online or stream them to subscribers for monthly fee.

docs.snippet: If Google deems an image revenge porn, it will still be accessible to someone who knows the direct web address of the image. But once delisted from Google, the image could not be found through the search engine....

headline.main: Google to Remove ‘Revenge Porn’ Images From Search Results

docs.abstract: If Google deems an image revenge porn, it will still be accessible to someone who knows the direct web address of the image. But once delisted from Google, the image could not be found through the search engine.

docs.snippet: Regulators say that Google uses its 90 percent market share in Europe to favor its own services over those of rivals like Microsoft....
docs.lead_paragraph: Regulators say that Google uses its 90 percent market share in Europe to favor its own services over those of rivals like Microsoft.

headline.main: European Regulators Lay Out Demands and Fines in Google Antitrust Case
headline.print_headline: European Regulators Lay Out Demands and Fines in Google Antitrust Case

docs.abstract: Statement of objections reveals for first time exact changes demanded by European antitrust authorities in five-year case against Google; company could face significant fines and other penalties if it does not give rivals greater share in search results.

byline.contributor: Conor Dougherty contributed reporting from San Francisco.

docs.snippet: So-called software containers got backing from companies including Cisco Systems and Google, while another group of companies detailed plans to automate certain aspects of cloud computing....

headline.main: Tech Companies Line Up Behind ‘Containers’ and the Cloud
headline.print_headline: Zest Finance Takes Big Data Credit Scoring to China

docs.abstract: So-called software containers got backing from companies including Cisco Systems and Google, while another group of companies detailed plans to automate certain aspects of cloud computing.

docs.snippet: Google is taking over an abandoned coal plant in Alabama for its seventh U.S. data center and trying to tie the old fossil fuel facility to alternative energy sources....

headline.main: Google to Open New Data Center in Alabama
headline.print_headline: Google Expands Again and Opens New Data Center

docs.abstract: Google is taking over an abandoned coal plant in Alabama for its seventh U.S. data center and trying to tie the old fossil fuel facility to alternative energy sources.

docs.snippet: Starting Wednesday, Google Maps, using its Street View technology, will offer web users views of El Capitan from a rock climber’s perspective....
docs.lead_paragraph: Starting Wednesday, Google Maps, using its Street View technology, will offer web users views of El Capitan from a rock climber’s perspective.

headline.main: Google’s Street View Takes Armchair Climbers Up El Capitan

docs.snippet: Tech giants like eBay, Facebook and Google acknowledge that they have work to do to increase diversity, but the repetition of that sentiment shows how little has changed....

headline.main: Behind Silicon Valley’s Self-Critical Tone on Diversity, a Lack of Progress
headline.print_headline: Behind Silicon Valley’s Self-Critical Tone on Diversity, a Lack of Progress

docs.abstract: Tech giants like eBay, Facebook and Google acknowledge that they have work to do to increase diversity, but the repetition of that sentiment shows how little has changed.

docs.snippet: Details on the Google Consumer Surveys and on an analysis of The New York Times weddings pages....
docs.lead_paragraph: Details on the Google Consumer Surveys and on an analysis of The New York Times weddings pages.

headline.main: About the Maiden-Name Analysis

docs.snippet: Want to find what you didn’t know you were looking for? Don’t go to Google....
docs.lead_paragraph: Want to find what you didn’t know you were looking for? Don’t go to Google.

headline.main: Letter of Recommendation: Alternative Search Engines
headline.print_headline: Alternative Search Engines

docs.abstract: Joshua Cohen Letter of Recommendation column highlights several search engines as alternative to Google, some of which provide intentionally mysterious or challenging results.

docs.snippet: A years-long copyright fight between Google and Oracle will continue. At issue are the bits of code that help pieces of software work together, called Application Programming Interfaces....

headline.main: Supreme Court Declines to Hear Appeal in Google-Oracle Copyright Fight
headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Declines to Hear Google-Oracle Appeal

docs.abstract: A years-long copyright fight between Google and Oracle will continue. At issue are the bits of code that help pieces of software work together, called Application Programming Interfaces.

docs.snippet: The Federal Railroad Administration is hoping its new measure to integrate grade-crossing locations into mapping technology will curb the recent increase in crashes and fatalities....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Federal Railroad Administration is hoping its new measure to integrate grade-crossing locations into mapping technology will curb the recent increase in crashes and fatalities.

headline.main: Agency Taps Mapping Technology to Curb Rail Crossing Accidents
headline.print_headline: Agency Taps Mapping Technology to Curb Rail Crossing Accidents

docs.abstract: Federal Railroad Administration, in move to reduce railroad crossing accidents, plans partnership with Google that will send audio and visual alerts through driver navigation systems when motorists are approaching a crossing; number of rail crossing accidents rose by 9 percent in 2014, with 270 people dying in highway-rail collisions.

docs.snippet: Researchers presented 2,690 web users with two different versions of Google and found that the users preferred results that linked to rival sites....
docs.lead_paragraph: Researchers presented 2,690 web users with two different versions of Google and found that the users preferred results that linked to rival sites.

headline.main: Study Suggests That Google Has Its Thumb on Scale in Search
headline.print_headline: Universities’ Study Suggests Google Skews Search Results to Favor Its Own Content

docs.abstract: Yelp-funded study by Harvard and Columbia researchers finds users prefer search engine results containing information from variety of sources and suggests that Google disregards this preference by promoting its own content; experts question findings, which could spur government regulators to take up anti-trust investigations again.
